name: Pyruvate Kinase M2 Activator (TEPP-46)
description: Research compound that activates pyruvate kinase M2, shifting cellular metabolism from aerobic glycolysis (Warburg effect) back to oxidative phosphorylation. Emerging interest in longevity community for metabolic reprogramming and potential anti-cancer properties.

dosage.standard: Research compound — no established human dose
dosage.notes: Research-grade compound. Not commercially available as supplement. Included for awareness — represents emerging metabolic reprogramming approach.

keyFindings: Reversed Warburg effect in cancer cells (preclinical)
Improved metabolic function in aged cells in vitro
Represents novel metabolic reprogramming approach to aging
